name: Writ of possession, service, time limit for registration
text: When in any action in the nature of an action of ejectment an execution or writ of possession has been issued and served by the officer, the officer shall cause a copy of the writ, with a return of the officer's doings thereon, to be filed and registered within three months after the service and before the return of the writ into the clerk's office.  The plaintiff, in case the judgment was that the plaintiff was entitled to an estate in fee simple in the demanded premises, or in any part thereof, and for which execution or writ of possession issued, is thereupon entitled to the entry of a new certificate of title. [L 1903, c 56, §83; RL 1925, §3272; RL 1935, §5081; RL 1945, §12681; RL 1955, §342-81; HRS ; am L 1972, c 91, §1(dd); gen ch 1985]
